definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To pass on or transfer (information). [from 19th c.]
examples: The CCTV cameras relay what's going on to the headquarters.
Can you relay this message to John?

definitions.definition: ( obsolete , intransitive , hunting ) To release a new set of hounds . [15th–17th c.]
( transitive , now rare ) To place (people or horses) in relays, such that one can take over from another. [from 18th c.]
( intransitive , now rare ) To take on a new relay of horses ; to change horses. [from 19th c.]

main_definition: ( transitive ) To pass on or transfer (information). [from 19th c.]
